code: {(rdbHandles rdbDown) @\: x}each"-11!`",/:string exec logname from currlog where tbl in `trade`quote

code: all{correct:not any raze[subreq skey where not skey in uniqKey:x"-1+value .rdb.procnum"]in uniqSym:x"distinct(exec sym from trade),exec sym from quote";notwrong:all uniqSym in subreq uniqKey;correct&notwrong}each value rdbHandles
comment: Check updates were striped (correctly) AND (NOT striped WRONGLY) based on hash function

code: all{t1:(value rdbHandles)@\:"count trade";q1:(value rdbHandles)@\:"count quote";stpHandle@/:`.u.upd,/:((`trade;t x);(`quote;q x);(`heartbeat;`error));system"sleep 1"; cntChk:(x+sum[t1],sum q1)~sum(value rdbHandles)@\:"count[trade],count quote";cntChk&all{correct:not any raze[subreq skey where not skey in uniqKey:x"-1+value .rdb.procnum"]in uniqSym:x"distinct(exec sym from trade),exec sym from quote";notwrong:all uniqSym in subreq uniqKey;correct&notwrong}each value rdbHandles}'[{x*10}\[4;10]]
comment: Iterate 10 100 1000 10000 100000 rows update - Check tables update count and data striped accurately
